comments.html:
I've been extremely impressed with ChatGPT's ability to translate natural language queries into real, meaningful output, but generally less impressed by the confidence with which it gives completely wrong answers for many networking-related topics.

I asked it the other day to create a basic configuration for terminating a DIA circuit on a Cisco ISR 4331, and while it got it 90% correct, the remaining 10% would've left you locked out of the router without traffic being passed. I could see MSPs especially struggling with customers trying to save money by using ChatGPT instead.

comments.html:
Can confirm chatGPT 4o is pretty impressive most of the time when you ask it the more 'general' configuration type questions. As your answer from it goes it had probably seen many many instances of the question asked and so its statistical model was able to provide a sane and mostly correct answer.

Anytime you get towards what is likely more corner cases beware the LLM answers.
